name: Ning Yang 0001
content: Ning Yang Ning Yang 博士，副教授，博士研究生导师 中国计算机学会高级会员 中国计算机学会信息系统专业委员会执行委员 Ph.D, Associate Professor, Senior member of CCF Address: College of Computer Science Sichuan University Chengdu, China, 610041 Telephone: (86-028)85466105 Email: yangning at scu dot edu dot cn Office: B421 Basic Teaching Building [Research Interests] [Research Projects] [Brief Bio] [Publications] [Courses] [Google Scholar Profile] [Professional Services] [People] Research Interests Trustworthy Machine Learning (Adversarial Robustness, Fairness, Explainability, Privacy, Accountability, ... ) Recommender Systems Learning on Graph 科研经费充足，学习和研究环境宽松，欢迎对我的研究方向感兴趣的同学申请我的硕士研究生和博士研究生。 I am looking for motivated students who are interested in my research interests. Research Projects Current Projects Research on Key Techniques of Adversarial Attacks and Defense in Recommender Systems, Supported by Natural Science Foundation of Sichuan Province with Grant No. 2024NSFSC0516, ¥200K, 2024-2025 (四川省自然科学基金项目, 主持) Finished Projects Research on Fusion of Multiple Social Networks Based on Cross-network Information Diffusions, Supported by National Natural Science Foundation of China, General Program (Grant No. 61972270), ¥728K, 2020-2023 (国家自然科学基金面上项目, 主持) Research on Real-Time Computing and Analyzing Engine for Urban Big Data, Supported by Sichuan Province, Hightech Program (Grant No. 2019YFG0213), ¥200K, 2019-2020 (四川省支撑计划项目, 主持) Research on Key Techniques of Large Scale Social Sensing Data Mining, Supported by the Basic Research Program of Sichuan Province with Grant No. 2014JY0220, ¥100K, 2014-2016 (四川省应用基础计划项目, 主持) Research on the Mining of Information Transfer in Temporal Sequences, Supported by National Natural Science Foundation of China, General Program (Grant No. 61173099), ¥550K, 2012-2015 (国家自然科学基金面上项目, 主持) Research on the Mining of Information Transfer for the Predictions and Intervenions of Temporal Sequences, Supported by the Doctoral Fund of Ministry of Education of China (Grant No. 20110181120062), ¥40K, 2012-2014 (教育部博士点基金项目, 主持) Research on Key Techniques of the Mining and Application of Digital Traces in Internet of Things, Supported by Sichuan Province, Hightech Program (Grant No. 2011GZ0223), ¥100K, 2011-2013 (四川省支撑计划项目, 主持) Brief Bio I received Ph.D. in computer Science from the Sichuan University, Chengdu, China, 2010. Before coming back to campus, I was a programmer. Visiting Scholar at University of Illinois at Chicago, Supervised by Professor Philip S.
